revised_title: Reflection of Shadows and Images in Water and Air
tldr: The author, George Edwards, discovered that the shadows of objects floating in water are reflected more strongly from the air above the water than objects above the water surface are reflected from the water. This allows fish to see their images more clearly in the air, giving them an advantage over humans who view their reflections in the water. Edwards suggests that this discovery may have potential applications in the field of optics.
